intro: Quinquina × macivoriana, commonly known as the hybrid quinquina, is a hybrid plant resulting from the cross between Quinquina and Macivoriana species. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. This plant is characterized by its evergreen foliage and showy, fragrant flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-drained soil to prevent root rot. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in tropical and subtropical gardens.
